__e: Look who I ran into, Masha.
Now she's waiting for me to call, and she's still on the phone.
- Grown-ups don't hang up on friends. - Get away. And they don't hang up on their wives.
Maybe she doesn't know him. Maybe she had a dizzy spell and the first thing she could catch was his... elbow.
When I talk to her about going down into town to see some people, she looks at me with bleary eyes. She clings to me.
In that situation, you grab onto anyone, anyone who looks human and in the same shit as you.
Get off the phone and open this door!
Dad, get off the phone so we can eat.
I will disconnect, otherwise I lose the bus.
I raise an objection or two on the phone and she hangs up on me.
I'm sorry, but it happens three or four times a day. I answer, they hang up.
She wants me to call and when I do, she starts crying and hangs up on me.
I raise an objection or two on the phone and she hangs up on me.
I'm sorry, but it happens three or four times a day. I answer, they hang up.
She wants me to call and when I do, she starts crying and hangs up on me.
Come on. Quit stalling, Thorwald, or I'll hang up and call the police.
I'm going to hang up and don't you dare call me here again!
Then hang up and come straight over. It's already lunch time.
Now hurry and hang up, please.
